channel.title: Git on jdhao's digital space
channel.description: Recent content in Git on jdhao's digital space

item.title: Check Trailing White Spaces in Your Project
item.description:
When I am working on a Python project, I am using black to format the code, so that we have a unified format across the code base.

One pain point, however, is the super annoying trailing white spaces:

  1. black can remove trailing spaces for doc string, code and comment, but it will not touch trailing spaces in, e.g., multi-line strings.

item.title: Git line ending config
item.description: This post is about how to set up Git so that people using different operating systems can work in the same repository, without messing up the line ending of source files.

item.title: How to Use The Git-tag Feature
item.description: My notes on using tag feature of Git.

item.title: How To Install Latest Version of Git on Linux
item.description:
Update log

2021-12-10: update endpoint rpm link for git

The version of the default git bundled with the Linux system is often too old, and lacks certain features, which may break some tools. This post summarizes how to install newer versions of Git on Linux.

item.description: Some of the settings to make git log better.

item.description: Git has two option --git-dir and --work-tree. What is the use for them?

item.title: Find Line History in Git
item.description: When we are working on a real project, we may want to know from which commit a particular line is introduced.

item.title: Resolving Merge Conflict after Git Stash Pop
item.description: Sometimes, when we are working with our local changes in a Git repo, we may want to pull the latest updates from the remote repository. To avoid code conflict between remote files and local files. We can use git stash to store the unfinished local work temporarily.

item.title: How to Push Local Git Repo to Remote Repo in GitHub
item.description:
There are two basic cases when we push our local repo to remote repo. These two cases differ in their settings. But sometimes, we are easily confused.

#

item.title: A Tutorial on Creating GitHub Pull Requests
item.description:
Today I make my first ever GitHub pull request to the great Hexo theme NexT. I will summarize how to make a pull request in following post.

Creating a fork
#

According to GitHub documentation:

If you don’t have write access to the repository where you’d like to create a pull request, you must create a fork, or copy, of the repository first.
